comments.body: This is technically not accurate - you might not be expecting an identifier at all. For instance, you could have a type literal or a union type.

Probably it should just be: `'public' is not a valid identifier in strict mode. Class definition are automatically in strict mode.`

It's sort of besides the point what the meaning of the identifier is, we simply want to convey the fact that it isn't valid in strict mode.
Or simply ditch the identifier bit and go with `'public' is a reserved word in strict mode. Class definition are automatically in strict mode.`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@tests/cases/conformance/parser/ecmascript5/RegressionTests/parser553699.ts(3,21): error TS1213: Identifier expected. 'public' is a reserved word in strict mode. Class definitions are automatically in strict mode.
tests/cases/conformance/parser/ecmascript5/RegressionTests/parser553699.ts(3,21): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'public'.
